divs: sighting detailsdowntown kingston, on. april 13, 2012 outside talking on our deck, looking at the big dipper constellation above. objects appeared. 2 lights linked in some way travelling very fast almost like a "shooting star" \ falling meteor. object followed a straight line. direction: nne 90 degrees above the horizon was the first moment of sighting... within 1 to 2 seconds it faded about 30-40 degrees above the horizon. thought the object was natural - meteor falling through atmosphere or space junk falling out of orbit. noticed that the object had 2 lights, travelling in tandem that did not fluctuate in distance to one another. i called out, "i saw a 'shooting star,'" realizing quickly that falling meteors don't typically keep light up in near-perfect tandem. as it faded away at around 30 degrees above the horizon, i understood that i needed to report the object to mufon, even though it was likely a meteor.
trends: There have been 10 other sightings in Kingston
There were no other sightings in Kingston on or around April 13th 2012
Summary: 2 Meteors falling to earth in perfect tandem, going from 90 deg to 40 deg in 1 second
